question: [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Function: check()] [Cache coherency] SystemInformationProvider uses Arc<OutputCache> - can cache invalidation issues cause check() to compare stale baseline data against fresh target data, missing recent malicious changes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Function: check()] [Await point vulnerabilities] Multiple .await points (lines 80-81) - can task scheduling between awaits allow attackers to inject state changes that affect subsequent logic? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Trait: Checker] [Send+Sync bounds] Checker requires Send+Sync (traits.rs line 16) - is BuildVersionChecker truly thread-safe? Can interior mutability through config cause data races? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Trait: Checker] [Type confusion] Checker trait uses get_type_name::<Self>() for result labeling - can attackers exploit type system to inject malicious type names that get displayed in CheckResults? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Trait: Checker] [build_result static method] Self::build_result() is called from various places - can attackers override or hook this method through dynamic dispatch to manipulate CheckResult generation? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Trait: Checker] [CheckerError conversion] CheckerError variants have is_retryable() logic - can attackers exploit error type conversions to make non-retryable security failures appear retryable, allowing repeated attack attempts? [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Dependency: SystemInformation] [HashMap manipulation] SystemInformation wraps HashMap<String, String> - can attackers exploit hash collision DoS by providing keys that collide, causing O(n) lookup performance and DoS? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Dependency: SystemInformation] [Key iteration order] HashMap iteration is non-deterministic - does any code depend on key ordering that attackers could manipulate for timing attacks or logic bypass? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Dependency: SystemInformationProvider] [HTTP endpoint trust] Provider fetches from /system_information endpoint - can attackers MitM this endpoint to inject fake build hashes that pass validation? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Dependency: SystemInformationProvider] [JSON deserialization] serde_json::from_str() in provider - can attackers exploit JSON parsing vulnerabilities to cause crashes or inject malicious HashMap entries? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Dependency: SystemInformationProvider] [Cache TTL manipulation] Output cache TTL is configurable (cache_ttl_ms) - can attackers set extremely long TTLs to freeze stale data, or zero TTL to cause DoS through constant refetching? [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/node-checker/src/checker/build_version.rs] [Dependency: ProviderCollection] [Optional provider bypass] Providers are Option<Arc<Provider>> - can attackers manipulate the collection to make required providers appear None, triggering false positive checks? (High)
